[TableGen][DecoderEmitter] Shrink lifetime of `Filters` vector (NFC)

medium

This commit modifies the `FilterChooser` class within the LLVM project, specifically targeting the `Filters` vector. The changes aim to reduce the lifecycle of this vector by moving some related logic and variables outside it, improving code organization and potentially enhancing performance or readability.

  • Shrink lifetime of `Filters` vector
  • Move selected filter details into a unique pointer variable named `BestFilter`
  • Remove references to `BestIndex`, `Filters`, and move the initialization of `BestFilter` and other properties from within the constructor to outside it
https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project/commit/fc6024d8959cdb82e5421787882288e26ee728bc
TableGen
DecoderEmitter
NFC (Not For Commit)
llvm-project
LLVM
x86_64
low
Others

high
2025-08-17 03:59:07

This commit adds the `OneLineFormatOffRegex` option in the `format-off` section of clang-format, providing a concise way to disable formatting for lines that match a regular expression. It also changes documentation regarding when clang-format is turned off or back on.

  • Add `OneLineFormatOffRegex` option
  • Provides a concise way to disable formatting for matching regex lines

编译器维护更新

medium
2025-08-17 00:07:15

以上是一些关于GCC和Clang编译器的维护更新记录，涉及RISC-V优化、静态分析改进以及内存安全问题。

  • 修复了RISC-V中的vx组合模式missed DONE指示符问题
  • 更新了RISC-V中的vx组合模式支持指令列表
  • [Clang][Sema]检查了DiagnoseClassNameShadow的返回值
  • 解决了一种情况下编译gcobol程序时产生的内存未初始化读取警告
  • 在macOSX12.3 SDK下，对包含头文件<_stdio.h>进行跳过处理

M68k编译器增强：添加PCD地址模式任何扩展模式

medium
2025-08-16 23:33:47

此更新针对M68k架构的LLVM库（llvm/llvm-project），引入了新的anyext模式以处理PCD（Position-Dependent Code）地址模式。

  • 新增用于PCD地址模式的zext（零扩展）和anyext（任何扩展）函数
  • 增加了两个新函数：@test_anyext_pcd_i8_to_i16 和 @test_anyext_pcd_i8_to_i32
  • 这些函数分别演示了如何将i8数据转换为i16和i32，通过zext和anyext模式
https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project/commit/bc3754de0aed44147e64b99414ecb06f84ab1a91

[Github] Remove call to llvm-project-tests.yml from spirv-tests.yml

medium
2025-08-16 22:52:39

This is a GitHub Actions workflow change where the call to `llvm-project-tests.yml` in `spirv-tests.yml` has been removed. The aim is to eventually eliminate `llvm-project-tests.yml`, which should simplify these workflows at the cost of some duplication in GitHub Actions.

  • Remove call to llvm-project-tests.yml from spirv-tests.yml
  • Will eventually allow for removing llvm-project-tests.yml
  • Should reduce complexity in workflows
  • May introduce some duplicate steps
https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project/commit/1f5047e43092f39a60a0ddba921610c2ab00897e

MCSymbol 编译器符号类的更新

medium
2025-08-16 22:39:33

GitHub上两个关于llvm/llvm-project库的commit信息，分别涉及对`MCSymbol`类中`Kind::TargetCommon`字段移除和`SymContents`名称改为`kind`。这些变更改进了编译器的内部实现，使得编译过程更加高效。

  • Kind::TargetCommon 字段被移除
  • SymContentsEnum 被更改为 Kind 类型的 unsigned bitfield
https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project/commit/aa96e20dcefa7d73229c98a7d2727696ff949459
https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project/commit/190778a8ba6d30995b7e1b4b4a556ab6444bdf3a

clang[test] Location of Clang debug-info tests

medium
2025-08-16 17:33:21

Currently the Clang debug-info tests are spread across a couple of directories: I see the reasoning behind putting debug-info tests into the CodeGen directories since the debug-info generation lives in clang/lib/CodeGen, but should they be centralized under one directory? The clang/test/DebugInfo tests were recently introduced for the KeyInstructions work. It also aligns with where the LLVM debug-info tests live. How people would feel about moving these tests to a central directory?

  • Currently Clang debug-info tests are spread across multiple directories.
  • The reason for placing them in CodeGen directories is that debug-info generation happens there.
  • Recently introduced clang/test/DebugInfo tests for KeyInstructions work.
  • Aligns with where LLVM's debug-info tests live.
  • Questions about centralizing the tests under a single directory or having language-specific subdirectories.
https://discourse.llvm.org/t/clang-test-location-of-clang-debug-info-tests/87958
Clang
DebugInfo tests
CodeGen
LLVM

Clang-tidy misc-use-anonymous-namespace

medium
2025-08-15 15:27:02

Discussion about a Clang-tidy check that conflicts with LLVM's coding standard, leading to the creation of a new check: llvm-prefer-static-over-anonymous-namespace.

  • Existing clang-tidy check (misc-use-anonymous-namespace) is disabled due to conflict with LLVM's coding standards.
  • The need for a reverse check to flag file local functions in anonymous namespaces that should be made static has been identified.
  • A new check, llvm-prefer-static-over-anonymous-namespace, was created to address this issue.
https://discourse.llvm.org/t/clang-tidy-misc-use-anonymous-namespace/87947
Clang-tidy
Anonymous namespace
Static function
LLVM coding standard

LLVM 21.1.0-rc3 发布

high
2025-08-15 12:40:38

LLVM是一个广泛使用的开源编译器基础设施，版本21.1.0-rc3发布，并提供了针对不同平台的二进制安装包。

  • 多个平台（包括Linux和ARM64）提供二进制安装包
  • 每个平台对应一个特定的二进制文件名格式（如LLVM-21.1.0-rc3-Linux-ARM64.tar.xz）
  • Windows平台上使用不同的二进制命名约定（如LLVM-*.exe作为安装器，clang+llvm-包含完整内容）
  • 源代码包也提供：21.1.0-rc3.src.tar.xz包含特定子项目的源代码
https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project/releases/tag/llvmorg-21.1.0-rc3

Impact of ffp-contract defaults on benchmarking

high
2025-08-14 13:11:15

https://discourse.llvm.org/t/impact-of-ffp-contract-defaults-on-benchmarking/87906

  • Clang defaults to -ffp-contract=on for C/C++, disabling forming fused multiply-add across statements
  • GCC defaults to -ffp-contract=fast unless the std C dialect is set via e.g. std=c11
  • The difference in dynamically executed instructions affects SPEC CPU 2017 benchmarks such as namd and lbm significantly
https://discourse.llvm.org/t/impact-of-ffp-contract-defaults-on-benchmarking/87906
Compiler Defaults
Benchmarking

SPEC CPU 2017

RFC Emit a warning when -fsanitize-trap=<...> is passed without associated -fsanitize=<...>

medium
2025-08-13 21:20:55

The discussion revolves around the behavior of Clang driver, which currently silently ignores the -fsanitize-trap= flag if it is used alone. The motivation behind this RFC suggests that instead of ignoring such flags, a warning should be issued to alert developers about the unused flag.

  • -fsanitize-trap= is an Undefined Behavior Sanitizer (UBSan) flag enabling trapping UBSan
  • -fsanitize-trap= without -fsanitize=<...> does nothing and currently ignored by Clang driver
  • The proposed change would issue a warning if -fsanitize-trap= is used alone, similar to how unused flags are flagged in other cases
https://discourse.llvm.org/t/rfc-emit-a-warning-when-fsanitize-trap-is-passed-without-associated-fsanitize/87893
Clang
Undefined Behavior Sanitizer (UBSan)
Compiler Flags
Warnings and Errors

RFC: Support cheriot target triple as subarchitecture of riscv32

high
2025-08-13 12:44:06

Following a broader RFC for upstreaming CHERI, there is discussion on adding support for the CHERIoT in LLVM's target triple. CHERIoT is a full system architecture for a RISCV32E microcontroller.

  • Proposed addition of riscv32cheriotv1-unknown-unknown and riscv32cheriotv1-unknown-cheriotrtos triples to LLVM's target triple
  • Proposal includes parsing riscv32cheriot-... as an alias for riscv32cheriotv1-...
  • CHERIoT extends (and restricts) the instruction set, changes calling conventions, and alters capability and permission formats.
https://discourse.llvm.org/t/rfc-support-cheriot-target-triple-as-subarchitecture-of-riscv32/87883
CHERI
RISC-V
Target Triple
Microcontroller
Upstreaming

Thread safety analysis and std::weak_ptr

medium
2025-08-12 19:10:03

A discussion about thread-safe annotations for a project using std::weak_ptr, which does not support PT_GUARDED_BY.

  • std::weak_ptr doesn't expose operator* and operator-> methods.
  • PT_GUARDED_BY check requires a type that supports these operators (like pointers or those implementing them).
  • Alias analysis could potentially be used but is currently unsupported by the project.
  • The current solution does not work, as checking the weak_ptr's underlying type fails due to lack of operator* and operator-> methods.
https://discourse.llvm.org/t/thread-safety-analysis-and-std-weak-ptr/87864
thread safety
std::weak_ptr
alias analysis
PT_GUARDED_BY
x86_64

high
2025-08-12 15:42:36

  • 如果需要紧急处理的问题，请在9月份结束后重新尝试联系。
  • 在此期间，可以由其他维护者或@clang-area-team团队负责我可能需要处理的任务。

LLVM 21.1.0-rc3 Released!

high
2025-08-12 09:16:56

We are happy to announce that LLVM 21.1.0-rc3 is now released, including main LLVM project and its subprojects such as clang, lld, libc++, and MLIR. Download sources on GitHub or find binaries later in a specific forum thread.

  • LLVM 21.1.0-rc3 release
  • Includes main LLVM project and its subprojects: clang, lld, libc++, and MLIR
  • Binary availability note

Does calling finalizeBundle in a custom inserter keep an instruction sequence intact and bypass pre-Ra transforms?

medium
2025-08-12 01:38:17

https://discourse.llvm.org/t/does-calling-finalizebundle-in-a-custom-inserter-keep-an-instruction-sequence-intact-and-bypass-pre-ra-transforms/87822

  • The approach of wrapping an instruction sequence in a finalizeBundle to make it atomic to the pipeline and set MIFlag::NoMerge on all bundled instructions.
  • Pre-RA passes like peephole, CSE, sinking or scheduling should not affect the bundled instructions.
  • Using bundles is intended to preserve the sequence's semantics and layout until register allocation (RA) completes.
  • It’s recommended to expand pseudo-instructions post-RA if possible.
https://discourse.llvm.org/t/does-calling-finalizebundle-in-a-custom-inserter-keep-an-instruction-sequence-intact-and-bypass-pre-ra-transforms/87822

Using GOTPCREL relocations for personality and typeinfo eh_frame references?

high
2025-08-11 21:52:06

Discussion on using GOTPCREL relocations to handle personality and typeinfo pointers in Clang's eh_frame sections, specifically addressing issues with deduplication and write permissions.

  • Typeinfo pointers are emitted directly under the .data section without being deduplicated across compile units
  • Personality pointer is emitted in its own COMDAT section but still within the writable .data section on AArch64
  • On AArch64, indirect references to these pointers use sdata8 encoding, which supports up to 4 GB of code and data separation even in the small code model
https://discourse.llvm.org/t/using-gotpcrel-relocations-for-personality-and-typeinfo-eh-frame-references/87820

GCC 编译器改进提案

medium
2025-08-17 02:41:25

Jeff Law 发送了一封主题为 [PATCH 2/3] ira: tie output allocnos for fused instruction pairs 的邮件，讨论了如何通过将输出分配号关联到融合指令对来提高 GCC 编译器的效能。在回复中，Artemiy Volkov 提到了关于使用 PREV_INSN 和 prev_nonnote_nondebug_insn 的潜在问题以及这些方案的安全性考虑。

  • 讨论了如何通过将输出分配号关联到融合指令对来提高 GCC 编译器的效能
  • 提及在 scheduler 中使用 PREV_INSN 可能会导致笔记、线标记等出现在两个融合指令之间的问题
  • 建议使用 prev_nonnote_nondebug_insn 作为替代方案，因为它可能会遇到走过了基本块边界的风险
https://inbox.sourceware.org/gcc-patches/e685c33c-9539-417f-b5c2-8b0ee979aa74@gmail.com/

ira: tie output allocnos for fused instruction pairs

high
2025-08-17 02:40:28

You signed out in another tab or window. Reload to refresh your session.

  • Instruction pairs recognized as fusible by a preceding invocation of the dep_fusion pass require both components have the same hard register output for fusion to work in hardware.
  • For all such pairs, the following conditions will hold: (a) Both insns are single_sets (b) Both insns have a register destination (c) The pair has been marked as fusible by setting the second insn's SCHED_GROUP flag
  • (d) Additionally, post-RA, both instructions' destination regnos are equal.
  • During IRA, if conditions (a)-(c) hold, we need to tie the two instructions' destination allocnos together so that they are allocated to the same hard register.
https://github.com/gcc-mirror/gcc/commit/07a0baa7609a5a78d8b4a3c17897768fb2119605
gcc
compilation
fused instruction pairs

[PATCH] RISC-V: Fix block matching in arch-canonicalize [PR121538]

high
2025-08-17 02:30:14

The patch addresses issues with parsing conditional blocks for the riscv-ext*.def file. The initial regular expression used to match C++ lambda functions was too simple, causing it to only capture the first code block within braces. This led to incorrect handling of the 'c' extension dependency which includes two separate code blocks (one for RV32 and one for RV64). As a result, arch-canonicalize incorrectly added 'd' as an extra extension.

  • Initial regular expression was too simple
  • Only captured first block within braces
  • Incorrectly parsed 'c' dependency with two blocks
  • Leads to incorrect addition of 'd' extension
https://github.com/gcc-mirror/gcc/commit/14b15a9a473fc69b0251e625c397e70c396f0c0c
https://inbox.sourceware.org/gcc-patches/CA+yXCZBvnUS96jDDpm5AYAfO_MDXdbfzF5pRXPmyWcnhAaCFCg@mail.gmail.com/
https://inbox.sourceware.org/gcc-patches/20250816130439.734251-1-dimitar@dinux.eu/

PATCH: x86: Place the TLS call before all FLAGS_REG setting BBs

high
2025-08-17 00:48:15

A patch has been submitted to GCC's x86 compiler, aiming to place a Thread Local Storage (TLS) call at the beginning of basic blocks that dominate the current basic block. This is necessary because placing a TLS call before conditional jumps within a basic block could lead to clobbering of the register used for FLAGS, which would make it impossible.

  • Need to place TLS calls before all register setting BBs which dominate the current one
  • Avoiding conflicts with conditional jumps and other instructions that might affect flags register
  • Check for REG_DEAD notes in addition to searching for clobbers of the FLAGS register
https://inbox.sourceware.org/gcc-patches/20250817004804.3710369-1-hjl.tools@gmail.com/

[PATCH v2] c++: Fix ICE on mangling invalid compound requirement [PR120618]

medium
2025-08-16 21:02:19

This is a patch for the GCC compiler, addressing an issue where parsing invalid type-constraints in C++ code resulted in a compile error. The root cause was an Internal Compiler Error (ICE). The fix involves setting the trailing return type to NULL_TREE when encountering a type-constraint instead of a return-type-requirement, allowing some contexts to satisfy the constraint and prevent redundant errors.

  • Fixes ICE on mangling invalid compound requirement in C++ code
  • Sets trailing return type to NULL_TREE for invalid type-constraints
  • Allows valid constraints to be satisfied without redundantly reporting errors
https://inbox.sourceware.org/gcc-patches/CAD+gk=hBM+j_ffw3E+2Fpm3JvvWBLsSrOhViNjXXoqLdF5UbxA@mail.gmail.com/

Re: [PATCH v2] c++: Implement P2115R0 linkage changes for unnamed unscoped enums

high
2025-08-16 13:25:06

This email thread discusses a PATCH proposal to add support for unnamed unscoped enum types in C++, specifically addressing the linkage changes mentioned in P2115R0. The discussion includes feedback and alternative suggestions from Nathaniel Shead, who experimented with caching the property as a TYPE_LANG_FLAG for ENUMERAL_TYPEs, which he claims was possibly neater at the cost of using up a flag bit.

  • Discussion about adding support for unnamed unscoped enum types in C++
  • Proposed patch to implement P2115R0 linkage changes
  • Feedback on alternative patch suggestions and their pros and cons
  • Current status: Implementation only covers modules changes, further implementation needed for full P2115R0 standard
  • Production usage suggestion proposed for distinguishing the types

Implement __builtin_structured_binding_size trait

high
2025-08-15 20:38:41

  • Introduced a new trait for structured binding size (CPTK_STRUCTURED_BINDING_SIZE)
  • Handling of this trait is included in the finish_trait_expr function
  • The change affects traits related to array rank, type order, and structured binding size

c++: Add testcases for the defarg part of P1766R1 [PR121552]

high
2025-08-15 20:37:42

A patch has been added to GitHub repository gcc-mirror/gcc, which introduces new test cases related to default arguments (both function and template) in C++. The tests aim to ensure that the compiler correctly diagnoses multiple default arguments within a translation unit (TU), as well as when they are visible across modules. This includes handling cases where some default arguments are not visible but still considered equal, thus ensuring proper diagnostic behavior.

  • New testcases added for default argument functionality in C++
  • Ensures correct diagnosis of multiple default arguments within a translation unit
  • Tests visibility and equality of default arguments across modules
https://github.com/gcc-mirror/gcc/commit/91b5fc4ae2e5c8693cc0b619562f15f90c0fdfaa

Fix default argument parsing in non-comma variadic methods

high
2025-08-15 20:34:59

A fix for the issue of default argument parsing in non-comma variadic functions/methods was implemented in GCC. The fix addresses a deprecation issue where non-comma variadic functions were considered invalid.

  • The fix is part of the C++26 deprecation, though the syntax is still valid for older versions (C++98 to C++23).
  • Non-comma variadic methods are parsed correctly outside of classes or for out-of-class definitions of methods.
  • In cases where ... appears followed by ) without a closing bracket, it is considered part of the default argument and causes an error.
  • The fix involves setting done to true when encountering CPP_ELLIPSIS followed by CPP_CLOSE_PAREN at depth 0 in !nsdmi (non-scope-dependent macro instantiation).
  • A new test case was created for this issue.
https://github.com/gcc-mirror/gcc/commit/4bed19cf6170541ff757ee1b21d9fec9eb0c6541
c++, gcc, variadic methods, parsing, default arguments, C++ deprecation
high
x86_64
Others
GCC

RISC-V: fix __builtin_round clobbering FP exceptions flags

high
2025-08-15 17:40:35

This commit addresses a problem with the GCC compiler's handling of the built-in function `__builtin_round`, specifically in relation to how it interacts with floating-point exception flags (fflags). The issue was identified as `__builtin_round()` failing to properly save and restore fflags around an FP compare instruction, which could potentially lead to clobbering these flags. This commit aims to correct this behavior by altering the placement of flag restoration instructions.

  • __builtin_round() can inadvertently clobber floating-point exception (fflags) flags
  • GCC compiler needs to save and restore fflags correctly around FP compare operations
  • The specific code change involves adjusting where fflags are restored within the function
https://github.com/gcc-mirror/gcc/commit/f5696e9b1113b0a8e464cabb8cc26c871b1d9289
GCC

GCC编译器中关于.FAM与.counted_by属性的更改

medium
2025-08-15 15:28:10

此更改涉及GCC编译器中的代码，目的是在特定情况下生成对.FAM结构体的操作。改动位于.cfile文件中，主要的变化是处理了COMPONENT_REF结构和handle_counted_by_p函数。这些改动旨在确保当需要读取时，才会触发对.FAM结构的访问。

  • 改动发生在GCC编译器中的.cfile文件
  • 目的是在特定情况下生成对.FAM结构体的操作
  • 更改处理了COMPONENT_REF结构和handle_counted_by_p函数
